post.body: Loved Meraslava's song request 2day: *My favorite song is Jesus Wants Me for a Sunbeam.* (Remember?) It's translated now and a local hit.
Anybody have first-hand experience with *English First?* Rostov branch looking for teacher(s). Reviews on internet are mixed. Need 2 know...
"Hi expensive sister Ajlina" said translated letter from sister Tatyana in Siberia. Tues downloaded translation program, free triail period.
Hours on telephone - not my cuppa tea but so wonderful to talk with some family members overseas 2night and dear Pavel in Volgograd.
At orphanage met couple adopting Roma, 4, oldest child there. He's watched so many others leave with a new mom and dad. Finally: his turn!
I'm not believing it myself.That I'm home. I say home. I say h-o-m-e HOME in Rostov after being gone, gone, I say G-O-N-E gone for.2.long!
Hello from internet cafe,Kharkov, 2nd largest city of Ukraine, 2 million people. Just 30-some miles from Russia. Sightseeing, meeting folks.
Ten students 2day 4 English Club classes. Tomorrow 2 Kharkov, 6 hrs east. Taxi comes 5:30 a.m. Excited about meetng new team there.
Great day, good worship service, lunch after. A week of transitions: J & M return to Kiev, I head to Kharkov 4 days, then back to Rostov.
Baked yesterday's turkey in my hosts' oven and finally after 6.5 hrs of baking I called 'er done. An oven thermometer would have helped.
Did traditional Thanksgiving dinner. 8 of us including 4 from English Club. All interested in history of the holiday, our traditions.
Folks want a "traditional American Thanksgiving." Can't resist. Turkey, the works. Need an oven thermometer. Maybe FAX or email me one?
With Anya to Independance Square, Kiev. Thanks to CNN, likely you've been there via CNN during the Orange Revolution, 2004. Drizzle 2day/
English Club today, 9 present, studying Acts 7. Three have been reading the Bible together in English on their own time. Love it.
Ever hit someone with your umbrella? I did today on the metro when a guy shoved me to get on and I lost balance between train and platform.
English Club members met without me Thurs and read Bible in English for 4 hours, just to practice English. Would love to see them in church.
Get ready for a magnificent full moon that's heading toward you in the west. Tonight so cold, crisp and clear. A breathtaking evening!
The key to learning a language, says teacher Anna, is speaking it 2 hrs/day and studying all day. Now I know where So NOW they tell me! ;)
LOVE being near a major international airport such as Kiev's. Yesterday met college friend Cindy from VA and her team en route to Zhitomer.
First freeze tonight. Andrew just went out for a final spin around the block on his bike. At midnight!
